And all these people who read  that shit think the real Jay and  Silent Bob are a couple of faggots  'cause of that all these dicks are  writing about the comic book Jay and  Silent Bob! We gotta  put a stop to these hateful sonsa- bitches before they ruin our good  names!

The Internet's  given everyone in America a voice,  and everyone in American has chosen  to use that voice to bitch about  movies. As long as there's a Bluntman  and Chronic movie, the Net-nerds are  gonna have something negative to say  about it.  Jay steams, thinking.  Then, a light dawns on him.

dialogues.text: Jay and Bob stand and look at each other, filled with pur

dialogues.text: No way, man. It's just me and you  talking here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm tracking a monkey down  that's on it's way to Los Angeles,  and I could use some bureau backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles, hunh? Maybe we should  stake out Clint Eastwood's place.  Didn't he used to drive around with  a monkey that'd punch people and  drink beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents crack up. Willenholly's catching on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am, uh--Am I on speaker phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way--Dunston!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, now that's not fair. I know  I didn't make it as high up as you  guys, but my job's just as important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Will. Don't go all...  bananas on us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents crack up even more, Willenholly's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come to you as a friend--as a fellow  professional--and this is the shit I  get?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Will. Tell you what-- we'll get our best man on your case  right away. You might've heard of  him. He's a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Oh, a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Doctor Zaius!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents laugh hysterically, pounding the desk, Willenh tears up, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREW YOU GUYS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willenholly throws his cell phone across the car, the moc laughter still emitting from it. Willenholly cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Light FLASHES outside the soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and silent Bob stand amidst a line of EXTRAS. Silent looks O.C. goes wide-eyed, and pokes Jay, pointing O.C. J looks and sees-- A COLLEGE BAR set that looks like the College Bar from Go Will Hunting, complete with CLARK (the stuffy college jer MATT DAMON stands off to the side, loosening up for the s BEN AFFLECK calls to the O.C. DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we taking it from, Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus Van Sant sits off to the side, counting a stack of mo He just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a true artist, Gus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it from "It's a good  course."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now you're the director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, shove it. Bounce-boy. Let's  remember who talked who into doing  this shit in the first place. Talking  me into Dogma was one thing, but  this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry this is taking you away  from whatever-gay-killers-on-horses- who-like-to-play-golf-touchy-feely- flick you're supposed to be doing  this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--I'm touchy-feely? I take it you  never saw Forces of Nature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like a child. What've I been  telling you? Sometimes you've gotta  do the safe picture. Sometimes, you  do it for art. Sometimes, it's the  payback picture your friend says you  owe him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take a beat and look at the camera. Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sometimes, you go back to the  well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sometimes, you do Reindeer Games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's just mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay turns excitedly to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has gotta be the Bluntman Flick,  'cause that's those two fucks from  that Mork movie! Now all we gotta do  is figure out a way to get close to  them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A.D. grabs Jay and Bob by the arms and drags them ont the set, placing them near Ben and Matt in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stand there and react. Don't  say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob goes a little wide-eyed. Jay smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off A.D.'s comment) That's pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Alright, people. Lock it up. Let's  go for picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob eye Ben and Matt fiercely, Ben and Matt are  oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the count of three, we rush those  fucks and beat the shit out of 'em.  'Cause if they're all fucked up,  they can't make the move, right?  Alright, then.  One--two--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Will Hunting Two: Hunting Season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob freeze and look at each other, then O.C. The Clapper/Loader holds a clapboard in front of Ben's fa It does indeed, read: Good Will Hunting 2: Hunting Season

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene sixteen, take five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clapper/Loader claps the board closed and races off. looks to Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action, Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks up from counting his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Ben--I said I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben shakes his head and then starts the scene with CLARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should check it out, it's a good  course. But, you know, frankly, I  found the class rather elementary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't doubt that it was.  I remember that class. It was just  between recess and lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we gonna have a problem, again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no problem. I was still just  hoping you might give me some insight  into the evolution of the market  economy in the Southern Colonies.  See, Wood says--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping in) What'd I say? Didn't I say you'd be  back here regurgitating Gordon Wood.  But you forgot about Vickers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just read Vickers, so I'm up  on inherited wealth, Hunting. But  you're not the angry, brilliant young  mind you once were, just itching to  vent your frustrations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Jay and Silent Bob get bored and head of the shot. After a beat, they get pushed back in by the A.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once Sean told you it wasn't your  fault, you lost the edge, William.   You stopped hitting the books with a  vengeance, and now I've read shit  you haven't even heard about yet.  Face facts, my friend--love made you  a soft little pussy boy, unable to  stand up to an academic showdown,  like you used to. You're just no  longer that good--Will Hunting. (gets in his face) Now how do you like them apples?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt/Will turns away angrily, facing Ben/Chuckie, looking downwards, steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the sound of them apples.  Will, what're we gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie-- (snarling) It's Hunting season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt/Will spins to face Clark with two huge guns in his h He blows Clark away, Jay and Bob hit the deck. Matt/Will  stands there, guns smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apple sauce, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door to the soundstage swings open, and the  Security guard Jay knocked out rushes in, followed by oth SECURITY GUARDS who comb the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt, sirs, but have a  ten-oh-seven on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second! I wasn't with any  hookers today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard sees Jay and Bob crouched behind Ben, points, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE THEY ARE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Matt turn to Jay and Bob, Jay smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affleck, you're the bomb in Phantoms,  yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob then race out-of-frame, closely followed by t Security guards.  Matt head off, arms thrown in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone's looking for me, I'll be  in my trailer trying to figure out  how I got here from an Academy Award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob rush out, pulling a bench in front of the doo blocking it. They race ten feet to another soundstage acr from them and head inside a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Silent Bob rush in to see-- Wes Craven getting ready to direct a scene with a familia looking GHOSTFACE KILLER and SHANNEN DOHERTY. The  Clapper/Loader's clapboard reads: Scream 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scream four, scene thirty-seven,  take one. (claps it and rushes  off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Killer chases Shannen around the room, falling over s until she hits him with a lamp, knocking him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you bastard! Let's see who  you really are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannen pulls the mask off the short performer to reveal  SUZANNE. Jay and Silent Bob go wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Miramax-- (getting up) CUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannen heads over to Wes, holding the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannen, usually I say "cut."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monkey? Jesus, you guys aren't  even trying anymore, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market research suggest that  people love monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Silent Bob rush in, grab Suzanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE LOVE THIS MONKEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush out. West shrugs to Shannen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security Guards race through, chasing after the exited pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob race through the lot, with Bob carrying Suzan On a fake New York city street, another movie is shooting The trio, bob and weave through the shoot, until-- At the end of the alley, a set GOLF CART pulls up, and fo Security Guards pile out, forming a human wall, blocking  their path. Jay and Bob stop dead, looking back to see th other Security Guards gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a P.A. on a bike pulls up nearby. He ditches t bike and grabs papers from the large hanging basket in fr Jay and Bob look at each other, race over to the bike, an jump on, putting Suzanne in the basket. They start pedali away furiously, closely followed by the Security Guard po Silent Bob peddles like mad, racing toward the Golf Cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNCH IT!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob pops a wheelie and the Bike races up the front of the vehicle, taking flight, Below, the Security Guards stare in awe as-- Jay and Silent Bob atop the bike--with Suzanne in the fro basket--go past a moon (on a billboard, on the side of a  soundstage) a la E.T. Jay and Bob look down, then at each other. They smile. Th they look ahead and let out a scream. The bike crashes through a window in the side of a Sounds Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bike lands, and Jay and Bob, and Suzanne go tumbling  onto the floor covered in glass. They look up to see. JAMES VAN DER BEEK AND JASON BIGGS dressed as Jay and Sil Bob, looking down as them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit--that looked like it hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys alright? (off Suzanne) Hey! They've got a monkey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob look at their twins, then at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I think that shit just kicked  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you guys on your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Jason help Jay and Silent Bob to their feet. Al stare at one another, perplexed, Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to James) See man?  Its never, "Hey--you were  in Loser, or, "Dude--you rocked in  Boys and Girls." It always comes  back to that fucking pie! I'm haunted  by it.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you put your dick in a pie,  dude--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! (to Jay) Jason Biggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo-you really get to third base with  the Russsian chick like you did in  the movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Shannon? Sadly, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fucking hot, man. If I was  you, I'd been like--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay mimes a series of sexual maneuvers. Jason and James l on, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off James's-look) What, man? You never did one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay starts miming again, and suddenly stops, staring at J blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit? You're the Dawson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's James, actually. James Van Der  Beek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, what's up with Pacey stealing  Joey away from you? If I was you, I  would've drowned his ass in your  Creek and shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Because what--is Josh better  looking than me? Fuck, no. I mean,  who on earth is better looking that  me? I ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, man! She's too fine! Yo--did  you ever get to third base with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there was this one time-- (catching himself) Wait a second--who are you guys?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're our stunt doubles, dumbass. (to Jay) Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunt doubles for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie we start shooting in a few  minutes--Bluntman and Chronic Strike  Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) You're doubling me. I'm playing  Bluntman, AKA Silent Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And he's playing Chronic. AKA  Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay! Shit, did you even read the  script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob stare at them, blankly. Then Jay puts up his  finger, indicating they should wait a minute. He gets int huddle with Silent Bob and Suzanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the guys who are playing  us, yo. We take them out, and bickety- bam! No movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent Bob nods at Jay, then Suzanne. Suzanne heads off,  leaving Jay and Bob to huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Jay and Bob, to  James) What's with the weird, gay huddle  going on over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gay about it? It's two guys  talking in a corner. Man--why are  you such a homophobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a homophobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. You're always calling things  gay. "Ooo--look at the gay huddle,  dude!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--look at the monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next you're going to tell me the  monkey's gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so cute-- (to Suzanne) C'mere. Monkey. C'mere--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne pulls Jason and James out of the frame. While Jay and Silent Bob continue to huddle, the sounds o beating are heard, O.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here's what we do: start  swinging, and don't stop until those  young Hollywood fucks are out of  commission. Ready? Break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob spin to face Jason and James--only to go wide eyed. Suzanne stands atop the fallen actors, who are bloo and beaten and knocked out cold. She holds her hands skyw clasped like a champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one funky monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a banging at the door of the dressing ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biggs?  Mister Van... Der-- Beek? This is Security. We've got a  pair of intruders at large, and they  crashed through a window we thought  might be yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to door; deepening  voice) Uh--yeah. They're in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have you hostage? Should we  call your publicists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I mean, we kicked those guys'  asses bad. They're--knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guards stand outside a door marked James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great work, sirs! If you let us in,  we'll take over--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through door) NO! Me and Jason Biggs are naked in  here! Together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security guard look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh--okay. We'll just be--outside the  door, sirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guards stifle a laugh, as one makes a blow j face to the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob opens an AIR VENT in the wall. He puts Suzanne into i and hands her the tranquilizer gun, miming to her. She no and starts crawling through the ductwork, Bob closes the  vent again, and starts rifling through a nearby closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are we gonna do?! How  are we gonna get out of here without  them seeing us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent Bob pulls a pair of hangered COSTUMES from the clo smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guards push a cuffed Jason and James into a  waiting Cop Car. The pair are still dressed like Jay and  Silent Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'VE GOT THE WRONG GUYS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! DON'T YOU RECOGNIZE ME?! I'M  THE PIE-FUCKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cops) He'll be the pie--in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob creep toward a door (we don't see the outfits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a good idea, Lunchbox. In  these outfits we're totally incognito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, and A.D. appears, grabbing them by the shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biggs? Mister Van Der Beek?  Great--you've changed costumes  already. Let's get you to set. (pulling them off) The director doesn't like to be kept  waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like the Batcave, but it's not. Off to the side, near the monitor and chair setup, a black DIRECTOR eyebal the hustling, white crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all these crackers, Seventy  million dollars and I can't even get  a black grip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white P.A. brings a cup of latte to the Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your coffee, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes the coffee) You spit in this?  Because I know  all you white folks are pissed off  that the studio'd entrust a multi- million dollar to a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't spit in it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then taste it! Go on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The P.A. takes the cup and sips from it. He tries to hand back to the Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it ain't all good. Oh, you think  I want it now, after your lips touched  the cup? Get the fuck off my set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the man, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you the Man! And that's the  problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Director glares at the scared P.A., as he cautiously  skulks off. BANKY EDWARDS approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Chaka? Yeah, hi--I'm Banky  Edwards, the creator of Bluntman and  Chronic. We met a few weeks back.  I'm the executive producer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--you're the executive producer,  hunh? Well go "produce" me a latte  no white folks spit in--okay Fucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky. I just wanted you to know  that I respect your work as an artist.  I'm something of an artist myself. I  was the inker on the comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inker? What, like you trace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banky's face drops as the A.D. joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggs and Van Der Beek are on the  set, Chaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see 'em. Where are they? (into bullhorn) WHERE THE FUCK ARE THE STARS OF THIS  PIECE OF SHIT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Bluntcave set, two massive doors open in the fake  rock. Smoke pours in, and Jay and Silent Bob--now dressed BLUNTMAN AND CHRONIC--step from the darkness. Jay and Bob survey the set, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must've set 'em back a couple  hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this shit. (off their outfits) A gay hood ornament, and the color  Purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck am I? I'm the fucking  director, is who I am. Chaka Luther  King. The creator of all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec--I thought Holden and  Banky created this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm stealing it. I'm taking it  back for all the shit you people  have stolen from us! Did you know, I  came up with the idea for Sesame  Street before PBS? I was going to  call it N.W.P.--Niggaz with Puppets. (beat) Alright--enough small talk. Let's  shoot it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaka heads back toward his monitor. Jay and Bob are conf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait!! Aren't you gonna  direct us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be directing you to the food  stamps line after I fire your ass,  if you talk back like that to me  again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't know what we're supposed  to do here. We didn't even read the  script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Neither did I. Shit, neither did  the studio. (pointing O.C.) Look man, it's not hard. In this  scene, the bad guy breaks into the  Bluntcave.  You make up some shit,  fight him for a while, I film it, I  yell "cut," and then head back to my  trailer, where I got more white women  waiting for me there than the first  lifeboat off the Titanic! (confidentially) They all want a part of the movie,  and I got just the part for 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Silent Bob go wide-eyed, as Chaka heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET'S ROLL WITH THE NEW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUIET ON THE SET! THIS IS A TAKE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaka climbs behind his monitor. The P.A. is waiting for with another cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you another cup of coffee,  sir. Spit free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaka smacks the coffee out of his hand and sits down. The Clapper/Loader jumps in front of the startled Jay and Bob, getting ready.  After a beat, he turns to Silent Bob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna say that I loved when  you fucked that pie. (calling off) BLUNTMAN AND CHRONIC STRIKE BACK,  SCENE THIRTY-SEVEN, TAKE ONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clapper/Loader shuts the clapboard and races off. Fro behind the monitor, Chaka calls out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACTION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Bob (as Bluntman and Chronic) look at each other a beat. Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh--Snootchie Bootchies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the wall to their left explodes. Jay and Bob hi the deck. Through the smoking rubble steps COCK-KNOCKER-- arch--nemesis of Bluntman and Chronic.  He's a normal-loo man with huge, overgrown FISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I'd never find your  precious Bluntcave, did you, Hemp  Knight? But now you and your sidekick  are finally in the grasp of Cock- Knocker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they call you "Cock-Knocker"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

And as we're  not only the artistic basis but also  the character basis for your  intellectual property, Bluntman and  Chronic, when we said property was  optioned by Miramax Films you were  legally obliged to secure our  permission to transfer the concept  to another medium. As you failed to  do that, you're in breach of the  original contract--ergo, you find  yourself in a very actionable  position.

dialogues.text: On Movie Poop Shoot.com. did you say  Jay and Silent Bob-- (reading off paper) "--are fucking clown shoes. If they  were real, I'd beat the shit out of  them for being so stupid."

dialogues.text: And finally, Jay and Silent Bob come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YO! THE PARTY'S ACROSS THE STREET,  FEATURING THE GREATEST BAND IN THE  WORLD: MORRIS DAY AND THE TIME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN to Morris day and The Time on stage, performing  "The Bird." During the song, Morris points to-- Jay and Bob, who are dancing with Suzanne and Justice (wh still in cuffs, flanked by the Guards). Jay looks to Bob, they nod at each other and-- Jay and Silent Bob, join Morris Day and the TIME onstage, and dance us out to the coda, which reads--

dialogues.speaker: CODA
dialogues.text: Bluntman and Chronic Strike Back went on to make a mere 2 million at the box office. It was the biggest commercial  failure in the history of Miramax films.  The film was ro drubbed as a bad idea by the denizens of the Internet cha boards, and over the course of the next year, while they  waited for the Quick Stop restraining order to expire, Ja and Silent Bob tracked them all down and beat the shit ou of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A familiar WOMAN closes a book that's marked: THE VIEW  ASKEWNIVERSE. She puts the book down, smiles at us and sk off.
